title: When was the very first telephone created? - Quora

response.answer_text: The idea of the telephone was not a totally unique idea when Alexander Graham Bell was granted the patent in 1876. The telephone was an extension of the work done by Samuel Morse in developing the telegraph. History books tell us Samuel Morse invented the telegraph based on a 1837 patent. In researching the history of the telephone I discovered that another inventor, Dr. David Alter, invented his own version of the telegraph in 1836. Some sources state that Alter also invented a "speaking telegraph," a forerunner of the modern telephone system. Learn more here: Tom Peracchio's answer to Who invented the telephone?
